Line 18: Line 18:
''Resurrection erotica'' is a set of artistic sub-genres wherein a person is brought back from a nonresponsive state (death, or a coma) by an expression, sometimes graphically physical, of romantic or sexual love. An example of this in [[fairy tale]] is the [[Sleeping Beauty]] parable.
''Resurrection erotica'' is a set of artistic sub-genres wherein a person is brought back from a nonresponsive state (death, or a coma) by an expression, sometimes graphically physical, of romantic or sexual love. An example of this in [[fairy tale]] is the [[Sleeping Beauty]] parable.
â
The [[controversial]] [[Germany | German]] film [[Nekromantik]] offers a graphic portrayal of sexual necrophilia, and the [[Canadian]] film ''[[Kissed (film) | Kissed]]'' is about a woman who works in a morgue and finds herself erotically drawn to the corpses she deals with. In the [[1970s]], shock rocker [[Alice Cooper]] recorded a couple of songs about necrophilia, "I Love the Dead", and "Cold Ethyl". In the [[1980s]] and [[1990s | '90s]], necrophilia emerged in the [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]] sub-genres of [[death metal]], [[black metal]] and [[goregrind]]. In [[1993]], a [[music video]] for [[Tom Petty]]'s hit song "[[Last Dance with Mary-Jane]]" featured the singer simulating various romantic poses with a dead woman (played by [[Kim Basinger]]).
+
The [[controversial]] [[Germany | German]] film [[Nekromantik]] offers a graphic portrayal of sexual necrophilia, and the [[Canadian]] film ''[[Kissed (film) | Kissed]]'' is about a woman who works in a morgue and finds herself erotically drawn to the corpses she deals with. In the [[1970s]], shock rocker [[Alice Cooper]] recorded a couple of songs about necrophilia, "I Love the Dead", and "Cold Ethyl". In the [[1980s]] and [[1990s | '90s]], necrophilia emerged in the [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]] sub-genres of [[death metal]], [[black metal]] and [[goregrind]]. A [[Goth-rock]] band know as the Murderdolls lead my Wednesday 13 I man who have created a life style out of singing about Necrophilia and sexual acts with the dead. In [[1993]], a [[music video]] for [[Tom Petty]]'s hit song "[[Last Dance with Mary-Jane]]" featured the singer simulating various romantic poses with a dead woman (played by [[Kim Basinger]]).
